Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum had 29 points, Kristaps Porzingis finished with 25 points and 11 rebounds.
Jrue Holiday scored 19 points and Jaylen Brown contributed 14 for the Celtics.
Russell Westbrook scored 26 points and grabbed nine rebounds for Denver.

Jamal Murray and Julian Strawther each scored 19 points, Michael Porter Jr. had 15 points and 10 rebounds, Peyton Watson contributed 14 points and Christian Braun finished with 12 points for the Nuggets.
The Celtics used a strong fourth quarter to break open a close game.
Boston took an 88-83 edge into the fourth quarter.
Strawther tied the game at 88 with a triple just 1:10 into the final frame.
The Celtics went on a decisive 15-0 run that made it 108-93 with 4:29 remaining.
Tatum punctuated the rally with a trio of free throws.
Denver failed to score for over four minutes during the Celtics' 15-0 run.
Pre-Game Insights: Boston was without guard Derrick White due to an illness.
Denver played without reigning MVP Nikola Jokic and forward Aaron Gordon. Jokic missed his fourth game of the season due to illness.
Post-Match Reflections: Despite punching back with seven straight points to trim its deficit to 108-100 with 3:26 remaining, Denver didn’t have enough gas in the tank to complete a comeback and lost for the second time in three games.
Boston saw a 15-point lead vanish in the first half and had to settle for a 57-57 tie at the break.
